meanings.definition: A person who is responsible for a crime or other misdeed.
meanings.sent1: The culprit stole the cookies from the jar.
meanings.sent2: The police caught the culprit red-handed.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous culprit left a trail of crumbs behind.
meanings.sent4: The culprit's fingerprints were all over the scene.
meanings.sent5: The culprit confessed to the crime after being caught.

meanings.definition: The cause of a problem or defect.
meanings.sent1: The leaky faucet turned out to be the culprit of the high water bill.
meanings.sent2: After investigation, they found the faulty wiring was the culprit of the power outage.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky culprit hiding in the system caused the glitch.
meanings.sent4: The lack of maintenance was the silent culprit behind the machine breakdown.
meanings.sent5: Identifying the culprit is the first step to solving the issue.
